channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: New Guidelines Endorse Self-Swab Alternative to Pap Smear for Cervical Cancer Testing
item.description: The recommendation comes after the first at-home test, a self-swab, received federal approval last year.

item.title: Venezuela swears in interim leader, seeking to show it operates free from U.S. control
item.description: Delcy Rodríguez was sworn in as interim president, as the Venezuelan government sought to show its people and the world that it is being run independe...

item.title: Health officials slash the number of vaccines recommended for all kids
item.description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is reducing the number of vaccines recommended for all children. The action follows a presidential memo...

item.title: 'Everything I knew burned down around me': A journalist looks back on LA's fires
item.description: Jacob Soboroff was raised in the Pacific Palisades and reported live from the area as it was devastated by fire in 2025. In Firestorm, Soboroff offers...

item.title: Maduro and wife plead not guilty to narco-terrorism charges
item.description: Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores have pleaded not guilty to all charges during their first court appearance in their federal narc...

item.title: Don’t Call It Regime Change. This Is Something Else Entirely.
item.description: To understand what’s unfolding in Venezuela, you have to look to the mob, not traditional foreign policy doctrines.

item.title: Zelensky Taps High-Profile Canadian Politician as Economic Adviser

item.title: Iran Offering Monthly Payments to Citizens to Cool Protests
item.description: The payments are the latest step to alleviate economic pressures, but given the severity of the crisis, critics say, they are likely to do little.

item.title: The NYC jail holding Maduro has a history of big names and dangerous conditions

item.title: Jamie Dimon’s $770 Million Haul Shows How Bankers Are on Top Again

item.title: After Christmas Day Strikes, Fear Grips Muslims in Rural Nigeria
item.description: A small town set amid a smattering of baobab trees is grappling with the aftermath of a bombing ordered by President Trump.

item.title: Venezuela’s ‘Dirty’ Oil and the Environment: Three Things to Know
item.description: Most of the reserves in the country are extra-heavy oil that’s tough to extract and generates more greenhouse gases.
